title: Tree
data:
| [Dungeon features](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature")      |                                             |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| [  Air](/wiki/Air "Air")                                         | [\_ Altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar")             |
| [# Corridor](/wiki/Corridor "Corridor")                          | [# Cloud](/wiki/Cloud "Cloud")              |
| [#. Drawbridge](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge")                   | [+-\| Door](/wiki/Door "Door")              |
| [. Doorway](/wiki/Doorway "Doorway")                             | [{ Fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain")     |
| [\| Headstone](/wiki/Headstone "Headstone")                      | [.  Floor](/wiki/Floor "Floor")             |
| [>< Ladder](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder")                               | [. Ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice")                    |
| [# Iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars")                       | [} Lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava")                 |
| [} Moat](/wiki/Moat "Moat")                                      | [# Sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink")                 |
| [  Solid rock](/wiki/Solid_rock "Solid rock")                    | [>< Staircase](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") |
| [\ Throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne")                                | [^" Trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap")                |
| [# Tree]()                                                       | [- \| Wall](/wiki/Wall "Wall")              |
| [\~ Vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square") |                                             |

**Trees** are represented by ±, or by #, depending on your operating system and [options](/wiki/Options "Options").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Kicking](#Kicking)

- [3 Chopping](#Chopping)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Tress can be found:

- in the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest")

- in the home level of the following quests:

  - [Priest](/wiki/Priest_quest "Priest quest")
  - [Monk](/wiki/Monk_quest "Monk quest")
  - [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian_quest "Barbarian quest")

- in some versions of:

  - [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown")
  - the [Big Room](/wiki/Big_Room "Big Room")
  - [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island")

## Kicking

Kicking a tree yields:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- A 2⁄3 chance of being painful ([abused](/wiki/Abuse "Abuse") strength and dexterity, possibly [wounded legs](/wiki/Wounded_legs "Wounded legs")); or
- A one-time, 14⁄15 chance of generating a quantity of a random fruit. ("Some \<fruits> fall from the tree!") The fruit will be [apples](/wiki/Apple "Apple"), [oranges](/wiki/Orange "Orange"), [pears](/wiki/Pear "Pear"), [bananas](/wiki/Banana "Banana"), or [eucalyptus leaves](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaf "Eucalyptus leaf") (with equal probability). The quantity depends on your [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") (8−[rnl](/wiki/Rnl "Rnl")(7)); or
- A one-time summoning of [killer bees](/wiki/Killer_bee "Killer bee") (quantity dependent on your Luck) ("You've attracted the tree's former occupants!").

If the fruit gets caught in the branches, kick again to loosen them. Once you've gotten the fruit and the bees, kicking a tree will not do anything besides abusing your stats and injuring you.

## Chopping

Applying an [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe") in the direction of a tree will destroy it and has a 20% chance of generating a single random fruit (with the same probabilities as above), even if you already got some fruit from the tree by kicking it.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Doing so in the line of sight of a [watchman](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman") will anger him ("Halt, vandal! You're under arrest!"). [Rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray") will bounce off of trees without damaging them. Trees in undiggable areas, such as the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest") home level, are petrified and cannot be chopped down.

[Tunneling monsters](/wiki/Tunneling_monster "Tunneling monster") can also chop down trees; this will produce a single random fruit with a 1⁄3 chance.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## History

In [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"), the Priest, Monk and Barbarian quests were modified to have trees.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

Cutting down a tree in [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") will leave behind 1 to 3 [quarterstaves](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff") and/or [clubs](/wiki/Club "Club"). In addition, zapping a tree with a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death") will turn it into a [dead tree](/wiki/Dead_tree "Dead tree").

Given time, trees can also spread to adjacent squares as a result of the [Dungeon Growths](/wiki/Dungeon_Growths "Dungeon Growths") patch.

### SLASH'EM

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"New trees get spawned near existing trees?"*

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), there is also a forest of trees in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest").

## Encyclopedia entry

I think that I shall never see  
A poem lovely as a tree.  
A tree whose hungry mouth is prest  
Against the earth's sweet flowing breast;  
A tree that looks at God all day,  
And lifts her leafy arms to pray;  
A tree that may in Summer wear  
A nest of robins in her hair;  
Upon whose bosom snow has lain;  
Who intimately lives with rain.  
Poems are made by fools like me,  
But only God can make a tree.

\[ Trees - Joyce Kilmer ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/dokick.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1087](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/dokick.c#L1087)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 399](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/dig.c#L399)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1324](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L1324)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")

Tree

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Dungeon features
  Air _ Altar
# Corridor # Cloud
#. Drawbridge +-| Door
. Doorway { Fountain
| Headstone .  Floor
>< Ladder . Ice
# Iron bars } Lava
} Moat # Sink
  Solid rock >< Staircase
\ Throne ^" Trap
# Tree - | Wall
~ Vibrating square

Trees are represented by ±, or by #, depending on your operating system and options.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Kicking
  • 3 Chopping
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 UnNetHack
    • 5.2 SLASH'EM
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry
  • 7 References

Generation

Tress can be found:

  • in the Ranger quest
  • in the home level of the following quests:
    • Priest
    • Monk
    • Barbarian
  • in some versions of:
    • Minetown
    • the Big Room
    • Medusa's Island

Kicking

Kicking a tree yields:[1]

  • A 2⁄3 chance of being painful (abused strength and dexterity, possibly wounded legs); or
  • A one-time, 14⁄15 chance of generating a quantity of a random fruit. ("Some <fruits> fall from the tree!") The fruit will be apples, oranges, pears, bananas, or eucalyptus leaves (with equal probability). The quantity depends on your Luck (8−rnl(7)); or
  • A one-time summoning of killer bees (quantity dependent on your Luck) ("You've attracted the tree's former occupants!").

If the fruit gets caught in the branches, kick again to loosen them. Once you've gotten the fruit and the bees, kicking a tree will not do anything besides abusing your stats and injuring you.

Chopping

Applying an axe in the direction of a tree will destroy it and has a 20% chance of generating a single random fruit (with the same probabilities as above), even if you already got some fruit from the tree by kicking it.[2] Doing so in the line of sight of a watchman will anger him ("Halt, vandal! You're under arrest!"). Rays will bounce off of trees without damaging them. Trees in undiggable areas, such as the Ranger quest home level, are petrified and cannot be chopped down.

Tunneling monsters can also chop down trees; this will produce a single random fruit with a 1⁄3 chance.[3]

History

In NetHack 3.6.0, the Priest, Monk and Barbarian quests were modified to have trees.

Variants

UnNetHack

Cutting down a tree in UnNetHack will leave behind 1 to 3 quarterstaves and/or clubs. In addition, zapping a tree with a wand of death will turn it into a dead tree.

Given time, trees can also spread to adjacent squares as a result of the Dungeon Growths patch.

SLASH'EM

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"New trees get spawned near existing trees?"

In SLASH'EM, there is also a forest of trees in the Lawful Quest.

Encyclopedia entry

I think that I shall never see
A poem lovely as a tree.
A tree whose hungry mouth is prest
Against the earth's sweet flowing breast;
A tree that looks at God all day,
And lifts her leafy arms to pray;
A tree that may in Summer wear
A nest of robins in her hair;
Upon whose bosom snow has lain;
Who intimately lives with rain.
Poems are made by fools like me,
But only God can make a tree.

[ Trees - Joyce Kilmer ]

References

  1. ↑ src/dokick.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1087
  2. ↑ src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 399
  3. ↑ src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1324

{{features}}
'''Trees''' are represented by {{Green|±}}, or by {{Green|#}}, depending on your operating system and [[options]].

==Generation==
Tress can be found:
* in the [[Ranger quest]]
* in the home level of the following quests:
** [[Priest quest|Priest]]
** [[Monk quest|Monk]]
** [[Barbarian quest|Barbarian]]
* in some versions of:
** [[Minetown]]
** the [[Big Room]]
** [[Medusa's Island]]

==Kicking==
Kicking a tree yields:{{refsrc|src/dokick.c|1087|nethack=3.6.0}}
* A {{frac|2|3}} chance of being painful ([[abuse]]d strength and dexterity, possibly [[wounded legs]]); or
* A one-time, {{frac|14|15}} chance of generating a quantity of a random fruit. ("Some <fruits> fall from the tree!") The fruit will be [[apple]]s, [[orange]]s, [[pear]]s, [[banana]]s, or [[Eucalyptus leaf|eucalyptus leaves]] (with equal probability). The quantity depends on your [[Luck]] (8−[[rnl]](7)); or
* A one-time summoning of [[killer bee]]s (quantity dependent on your Luck) ("You've attracted the tree's former occupants!").

If the fruit gets caught in the branches, kick again to loosen them. Once you've gotten the fruit and the bees, kicking a tree will not do anything besides abusing your stats and injuring you.

==Chopping==
Applying an [[axe]] in the direction of a tree will destroy it and has a 20% chance of generating a single random fruit (with the same probabilities as above), even if you already got some fruit from the tree by kicking it.{{refsrc|src/dig.c|399|nethack=3.6.0}} Doing so in the line of sight of a [[watchman]] will anger him ("Halt, vandal! You're under arrest!"). [[Ray]]s will bounce off of trees without damaging them. Trees in undiggable areas, such as the [[Ranger quest]] home level, are petrified and cannot be chopped down.

[[Tunneling monster]]s can also chop down trees; this will produce a single random fruit with a {{frac|1|3}} chance.{{refsrc|src/dig.c|1324|nethack=3.6.7}}

==History==
In [[NetHack 3.6.0]], the Priest, Monk and Barbarian quests were modified to have trees.

==Variants==
===UnNetHack===
Cutting down a tree in [[UnNetHack]] will leave behind 1 to 3 [[Quarterstaff|quarterstaves]] and/or [[club]]s. In addition, zapping a tree with a [[wand of death]] will turn it into a [[dead tree]].

Given time, trees can also spread to adjacent squares as a result of the [[Dungeon Growths]] patch.

===SLASH'EM===
{{todo|New trees get spawned near existing trees?}}
In [[SLASH'EM]], there is also a forest of trees in the [[Lawful Quest]].

== Encyclopedia entry ==

{{encyclopedia|
I think that I shall never see
A poem lovely as a tree.

Against the earth's sweet flowing breast;
A tree that looks at God all day,
And lifts her leafy arms to pray;
A tree that may in Summer wear
A nest of robins in her hair;
Upon whose bosom snow has lain;
Who intimately lives with rain.
Poems are made by fools like me,
But only God can make a tree.
|[ Trees - Joyce Kilmer ]
